head.supplied: 27th May [18]70 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I have the honor by direction of the Borough Council of East Collingwood respectfully to make application to you for another supply of trees and shrubs suitable for plantin...

div.p: Letter book 5, p. 740, VA 439 East Collingwood Borough Council records, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Transcribed 17.9.93. Proof.
The correspondent is George Bennett, d. 1879. For a summary of this letter see Council minutes, VPRS 11090, unit 4, p. 40, East Collingwood Borough Council records, Public Record Office, Victoria. The Minute book also records, on the same page, that at the meeting of the Council on 1 June, a letter from M agreeing to supply the plants was read. This letter has not, however, been found. 27th May [18]70
editorial addition.

I have the honor by direction of the Borough Council of East Collingwood respectfully to make application to you for another supply of trees and shrubs suitable for planting in the Borough Reserves. The Mayors Park containing six acres for which you kindly gave a supply of plants last year has been trenched with night and is now being ploughed preparatory to being laid down permanently with grass as Recreation Grounds. In consequence of the dryness of the season and the unexpected delay in laying the Water Mains our plantings of last season proved unfortunately in a great measure a failure. Nearly the whole of the Blue Gums died as there was no water to be got in the neighbourhood. The water Main now passes through the grounds and the land being trenched and well manured there is every probability that the plants will do well. In addition to the Mayors park there are 15 acres of a Reserve the Darling Gardens being now trenched with night soil and though the land will not be ready for the plants this season if you can conveniently supply them we could rear them in the Municipal Reserve in preparation for planting out in the Darling Gardens next year as the plants would thus be a year in advance.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
